subject: Management
title: Managing Your Own Emotions First
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Managing Your Own Emotions First.

hook.text: A manager entered a conflict conversation furious. The meeting lasted 90 seconds before someone walked out.

buildup.text: You can't manage conflict while your own emotions are flooding. You'll say things you regret.

discovery.text: Emotional regulation comes first. Calm yourself before trying to calm the situation.

twist.text: This isn't about suppressing feelings. It's about choosing when and how to express them.

climax.text: Take a walk, breathe, or delay by an hour. Never enter a tough talk at peak emotion.

punchline.text: Regulate yourself first. Then regulate the room.

quiz.question: Why is self-regulation critical before entering a conflict conversation?
options: Unmanaged emotions lead to destructive reactions you'll regret
Showing strong emotions always improves the outcome
Emotions have no effect on how conflict conversations unfold
